								Key given from developer for review purposes.Well this game sure is something...Don't get me wrong this game is still in earlt access and I have some hope for it but in this stage it's barely playable...Pros: ...-car models-interesting physics (for having fun, not intended)-good idea-nice weaponsCons:-repetitive music-unbeatable AI-no story-bad controls (pointless use of mouse)-zombies can only be run over (tested every weapon)-crashing in enemies only damages you-no servers/players-soooo many bugs-gameplay gets repetitive pretty fastRight now it's 2/10 but keep track of this one cuz it has lots of potential and I belive it can be turned in really good expirience.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
Early Access Review
Basic InformationTitle:  Iron MadnessDeveloper:  Inane GamesPublisher:  Inane GamesGenre:  Car combatGeneral ImpressionIron Madness is still in Early Access and yet the dev team has taken the wise decision to make the game Free to Play until they can iron out the still present bugs and glitches. It is their first project on Steam and it looks polished enough. It can be quite fun to play in co-op or split screen and it is a homage to already classics of the car combat subgenre. I shall give this game the benefit of doubt since it can still be greatly improved and receive Trading Cards and Achievements in a future update. It deserves them.Strong Points+ Nice 3D graphics.+ Free to Play.+ Potentially fun MP experience.Weak Points- Random bugs and glitches.- No Steam Trading Cards or Achievements.- Boring SP experience.Rating 6/10 This review was submitted for SUPER Giveaways.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								3/20/16: So...this is VERY MUCH early access. No doubt about that. What is here is very rough and I would say at least a year of updates will be needed to make it playable for the majority of Steam users. The menus don't make much sense. The content is at a bare minimum. AI is brutish and easily tricked. That said, it feels like the old Twisted Metal games. There is a lot of potential here. For .99 you get what you pay for at this point, but I have high hopes for this one. Also, "Missle Uzi" is the best name for a weapon ever.

content:
Posted: April 15
Early Access Review
								I'd describe this as the Bad Rats of car games. Me and a friend tried it since it's population is even smaller than that of Hiroshima's after August 6th. It runs on the Unity engine and as soon as it begns you are greeted with a menu that looks even more dated than if flash games existed on the PS2. A song that I can only describe as hard rock for transitioning Christians plays, one about rental cars which is fitting given that much like this game, no one would buy it. Getting into actual play, the game is so horribly optimised even though the original pong has better graphics so be prepared to turn each setting down to the lowest. Once you've done that, you're all set to go in and be matched on the same team as the only other player in the lobby in your private game. The stock weapon for your vehicle is pretty terrible, so as an alternative I recommend crashing into destroyable objects in game. These release an ear drum shattering sound equal to what one would hear if they were at the peak of Mount St. Helens when it erupted and is guaranteed to do far more damage to your opponet's very soul than anything the miniguns mounted to your car ever could. The laws of physics do not apply to this game either, as it's perfectly possible to drive up the side of a building and hang on, doing absolutely nothing. Overall I'd give this game a solid Mystery Diners/10, it's all four horsemen packed into one .exe - war, pestilence, famine and death. Prepare your anal cavity, the second coming of Christ is nigh.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have to say, Iron Madness is a pretty interesting game.However:Although I do understand this is an Early Access Game, I think it does need plenty of shaping before I starting playing this game purely for the fun of it."We want to have the community help us shape the game"- Iron Madness DevelopersI want to start by saying that this is a very cool concept and I think this can become something really cool, but I think there are a few corners that need to be smoothed out in the overall shape of this game.Pros: Cool Car Models Multiple gamemodes/maps Multiple powerups Multiplayer Decent Car Physics Split Screen ModeCons: Music seems repetitive AI Can become very difficult to beat Basic car controls Absolutly NO multiplayer games were available (I looked 4/27/2016) The environments you play in seem dark and not visually appealing Many bugs No storyline After the first 10 min. of gameplay the game becomes boring. The price of this game!!!I bought this game during a 90% discount for $0.49, but without the discount the game costs $4.99 and for the kind of content and gameplay I currently see, $4.99 is extremely overpriced.As harsh as it might seem, I think this game deserves a 1/10 rating - because it is overpriced - but if the price tag would shrink down to ~$1 (until much more content is added) I would give this game a healthy 3/10 because it is obvious to me, and probably anybody else that has played the game, that this game is not worth $5.*I crossed out the things which were not an issue anymore.I will check back later and re-evaluate my review if there are changes because this concept has much, much potential and I would love to see it grow!3/10, has lots of potentialThanks for reading folks :)

content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								The game thus far is a good start: Motor City Mayhem. I reckon this has the potential to be every murderous driving game since GW's original and completely mental 1984 release "Battlecars" (you may have noticed the alternative name in store). The sountrack is bonkers, the controls are classic, the maps are simple and effective-all in a very Early Access Game. For those of you with a good old-fashioned simple-minded attitude towards direct violence, I point out the low cost and potential of this game. For those of you without a sense of humour who just want a cheap game with Steam rewards and suchlike-go away. For anyone witha shred of hope-I suggest that you to look at "Orion: Prelude", a giant failure that ended up as a massively popular online game once the moaning clowns were driven from the discussion board by the designers' final release and the fans' support. Get stuck in to this for the price of a third-rate burger and chips or a substandard sandwich that will leave you hungry ten minutes later. It's your choice-a game that may eventually turn into a hilarious killfest for you and your pals when you wish it was 2001 and everything was metal AF, or another night in wondering what happened to the last fifteen years. Gentlemen, start your engines.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								It takes the greatest minds to put man on the moon. Yet here we are in 2016, still being blown away by what mankind can create. This embodies an artistic talent and philosophy that surpasses any other interactive piece of media ever created. The blood, sweat and tears poured into this game shows the moment you reach the title screen. From the first godly-rendered frame, you are presented with a life-defining experience that surpasses all of humanity's expectations. In centeries to come when man is dead, we shall not be remembered for putting man on the moon, we shall be remembered for Iron Madness.
